titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Keith Botsford Papers
titlestmt.author: by Andrea Benefiel and Lisa Conathan

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday April 24, 2019 at 03:06

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Papers consist of correspondence, writings, and other papers that document the life and work of Keith Botsford from the beginning of his career to 1969. Correspondence is both professional and personal, and documents Botsford's writing and editing activity, as well as his involvement in International PEN and the Congress for Cultural Freedom. Writings include corrected typescript and autograph manuscript drafts, proofs and other related material, dating from 1940 to 1967.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Box 112: Restricted fragile material. Reference surrogates have been substituted in the main files. For further information consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Keith Botsford Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Keith Botsford Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.

This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization. Various acquisitions associated with the collection have been partially interfiled and organized into series, and later acquisitions have been described separately in the contents list below.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

bioghist.head: Keith Botsford (1928-)
bioghist.p: Keith Botsford, European-American author and Professor Emeritus of Journalism at Boston University, was born March 29, 1928 in Brussels, Belgium. He has authored numerous novels, articles, essays and translations, and is the editor of News from the Republic of Letters .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Papers consist of correspondence, writings, and other papers that document the life and work of Keith Botsford from the beginning of his career to 1969. Correspondence is both professional and personal, and documents Botsford's writing and editing activities, as well as his involvement in International PEN and the Congress for Cultural Freedom. Writings include corrected typescript and autograph manuscript drafts, proofs and other related material, dating from 1940 to 1967. Other papers include a small quantity of personal documents and photographs.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into six groupings by series or acquisition: I. Correspondence, 1941-1969. II. Writings, 1890-1968. III. Other Papers, 1937-1968. IV. October 1964 Acquisition, 1906-1963. V. December 1965 Acquisition, 1958-1960. VI. November 1969 Acquisition, 1961-1967.

Researchers should note that material within each acquisition overlaps with/or relates to material found in other acquisitions. In order to locate all relevant material within this collection, researchers may need to consult each acquisition described in the Collection Contents section.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two subseries: General Correspondence, and Third Party Correspondence and Other Papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I consists of the personal and professional correspondence of Keith Botsford spanning the years 1941 to 1969. While correspondence is chiefly incoming, some files include retained copies of outgoing letters. The correspondence documents Botsford's writing and editing projects (including the early years of his collaboration with Saul Bellow), his activities with International PEN, the Congress for Cultural Freedom, and other organizations, and events that Botsford attended.
Principal correspondents include Saul Bellow, Rolf Fjelde, Helga Greene, Iain Hamilton, John Houseman, Jack Ludwig, Henri Peyre, Lawrence Richardson, Harvey Shapiro, and Roger Shattuck.

Center for the Study of Democratic Institutions
The Honorable Society of the Encyclopedia

Third Party Correspondence and Other Papers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Third Party Correspondence relates chiefly to International PEN and the Congress for Cultural Freedom. This subseries also includes a small amount of other papers: Botsford's curriculum vitae, schedules, and printed ephemera.

did.unittitle: InterAmerican Committee, International Music Festival, Rio de Janiero, correspondence and other materials
Lists of persons, questionnaires, information sheets

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into nine subseries, by genre: Novels, Articles, Early Fiction and Short Stories, Essays, Notebooks, Poems, Screenplays, Translations, and Writings of Others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II includes drafts of many of Botsford's writings before 1968, including his first four published novels: The Master Race (1955), The Eighth-Best Dressed Man in the World (1957), Benveunto (1961), and The March-Man (1964). The series also contains drafts of articles, essays, poems, translations, and screenplays by Botsford. The Writings of Others subseries includes manuscripts by Charles Hull Botsford.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series III consists of correspondence, reports and questionaires related to the International PEN conference in Bled, Yugoslavia in 1965, and financial and personal papers spanning 1937 to 1968.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alpabetically by subject or title. Existing order has been maintained. Unsorted and unidentified material is filed at the end of the group.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The October 1964 Acquisition consists of writings and subject files. Writings include autograph manuscript and typescript drafts, and notes. Subject files relate to writing projects (or planned projects) and include notes, clippings, photographs and printed material.
